text.div:
ReferralRequest Profile

Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

Mapping Summary

shr.core.ReferralRequest maps to ReferralRequest:
  _Entry.EntryId maps to id
  Language maps to language
  Narrative maps to text
  ImplicitRules maps to implicitRules
  Metadata.VersionId maps to meta.versionId
  Metadata.Profile maps to meta.profile
  Metadata.LastUpdated maps to meta.lastUpdated
  Metadata.SecurityLabel maps to meta.security
  Metadata.Tag maps to meta.tag
  Status maps to status
  Identifier maps to identifier
  StatementDateTime maps to date
  Replaces maps to extension
  RequestIntent maps to extension
  Type maps to type
  PriorityCode maps to priority
  ReferralSubjectOfRecord maps to patient
  ReferralRequester maps to requester
  Recipient maps to recipient
  CareContext maps to encounter
  ReasonCode maps to reason
  ReasonReference maps to extension
  CommentOrDescription maps to description
  ServiceType maps to serviceRequested
  RelatedInformation maps to supportingInformation
  ExpectedPerformanceTime maps to fulfillmentTime
  ExpectedPerformerType maps to extension
  Annotation maps to extension

name: ReferralRequest
description: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest
element.definition: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.id
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.meta
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.implicitRules
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.language
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.text
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.contained
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: replaces
element.definition: Request(s) replaced by this request

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-replaces.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-replaces.ext
element.definition: An Extension

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-replaces.url
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-replaces.val
element.definition: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

element.name: requestintent
element.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the request and where the request fits into the workflow chain.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-requestintent.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-requestintent.ext
element.definition: An Extension

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-requestintent.url
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-requestintent.val1
element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.name: reasonreference
element.definition: The justification, as reference to a condition or observation.

element.name: expectedperformertype
element.definition: What type of party should carry out the testing.

element.name: annotation
element.definition: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.

element.name: communicationmethod
element.definition: This is the method the provider used to communicate. Examples include: Written, Telephoned, Verbal, Electronically Entered, Policy, Service Correction, Duplicate, etc. 'Code indicating the origin of the prescription.' - NCPDP Telecommunication (Field 419-DJ, Data Dictionary 201104). Possible values include: Written; Telephone; Electronic; Facsimile; Pharmacy; Not Known.

element.name: referralrecipient
element.definition: The practitioner or organization receiving the referral.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.modifierExtension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.status
element.short: draft | requested | active | cancelled | accepted | rejected | completed
element.definition: The workflow status of the referral or transfer of care request.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.identifier
element.definition: Business identifier that uniquely identifies the referral/care transfer request instance.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.date
element.definition: Date/DateTime of creation for draft requests and date of activation for active requests.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.type
element.definition: An indication of the type of referral (or where applicable the type of transfer of care) request.
element.comments: Examples of referral type: - consultation;         second opinion;          third opinion - Assume management - Request for procedure(s)  HL7 v2.8 Example - Table 0336: S = second opinion p = patient preference o = provider ordered w = work load.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.specialty
element.short: The clinical specialty (discipline) that the referral is requested for
element.definition: Indication of the clinical domain or discipline to which the referral or transfer of care request is sent.  For example: Cardiology Gastroenterology Diabetology.

binding.description: Codes indicating the types of capability the referred to service provider must have.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.priority
element.short: Urgency of referral / transfer of care request
element.definition: An indication of the urgency of referral (or where applicable the type of transfer of care) request.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.patient
element.short: Patient referred to care or transfer
element.definition: The patient who is the subject of a referral or transfer of care request.
element.comments: Referral of family, group or community is to be catered for by profiles.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.requester
element.short: Requester of referral / transfer of care
element.definition: The healthcare provider or provider organization who/which initiated the referral/transfer of care request. Can also be  Patient (a self referral).

mapping.map: Practitioner: PRD-2/PRD-7 where PRD-3 = RP; Organization: PRD-10 where PRD-3 = RP

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.recipient
element.short: Receiver of referral / transfer of care request
element.definition: The healthcare provider(s) or provider organization(s) who/which is to receive the referral/transfer of care request.
element.comments: There will be a primary receiver. But the request can be received by any number of "copied to" providers or organizations.

mapping.map: Practitioner: PRD-2/PRD-7 where PRD-3 = RT; Organization: PRD-10 where PRD-3 = RT

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.encounter
element.definition: The encounter at which the request for referral or transfer of care is initiated.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.dateSent
element.short: Date referral/transfer of care request is sent
element.definition: Date/DateTime the request for referral or transfer of care is sent by the author.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.reason
element.short: Reason for referral / transfer of care request
element.definition: Description of clinical condition indicating why referral/transfer of care is requested.  For example:  Pathological Anomalies, Disabled (physical or mental),  Behavioral Management.

binding.description: Codes indicating why the referral is being requested.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.description
element.short: A textual description of the referral
element.definition: The reason element gives a short description of why the referral is being made, the description expands on this to support a more complete clinical summary.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.serviceRequested
element.short: Actions requested as part of the referral
element.definition: The service(s) that is/are requested to be provided to the patient.  For example: cardiac pacemaker insertion.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.supportingInformation
element.short: Additonal information to support referral or transfer of care request
element.definition: Any additional (administrative, financial or clinical) information required to support request for referral or transfer of care.  For example: Presenting problems/chief complaints Medical History Family History Alerts Allergy/Intolerance and Adverse Reactions Medications Observations/Assessments (may include cognitive and fundtional assessments) Diagnostic Reports Care Plan.

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.fulfillmentTime
element.definition: The period of time within which the services identified in the referral/transfer of care is specified or required to occur.
element.requirements: Use cases: (1) to indicate that the requested service is not to happen before a specified date, and saving the start date in Period.start; (2) to indicate that the requested service must happen before a specified date, and saving the end date in Period.end; (3) to indicate that the requested service must happen during the specified dates ("start" and "end" values).

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest
element.definition: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

element.name: replaces
element.definition: Request(s) replaced by this request

element.name: ReferralRequest-ReferralRequest.extension-replaces.val
element.definition: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

element.name: requestintent
element.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the request and where the request fits into the workflow chain.

element.name: reasonreference
element.definition: The justification, as reference to a condition or observation.

element.name: expectedperformertype
element.definition: What type of party should carry out the testing.

element.name: annotation
element.definition: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.

element.name: communicationmethod
element.definition: This is the method the provider used to communicate. Examples include: Written, Telephoned, Verbal, Electronically Entered, Policy, Service Correction, Duplicate, etc. 'Code indicating the origin of the prescription.' - NCPDP Telecommunication (Field 419-DJ, Data Dictionary 201104). Possible values include: Written; Telephone; Electronic; Facsimile; Pharmacy; Not Known.

element.name: referralrecipient
element.definition: The practitioner or organization receiving the referral.
